title: PHParray_key_exists()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHParray_key_exists()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
$a=array("Volvo"=>"XC90","BMW"=>"X5");
if (array_key_exists("Volvo",$a))
{
echo "Key exists!";
}
else
{
echo "Key does not exist!";
}
?>

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
$a=array("Volvo"=>"XC90","BMW"=>"X5");
if (array_key_exists("Toyota",$a))
{
echo "Key exists!";
}
else
{
echo "Key does not exist!";
}
?>

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
$a=array("Volvo","BMW");
if (array_key_exists(0,$a))
{
echo "Key exists!";
}
else
{
echo "Key does not exist!";
}
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHParray_key_exists()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHParray_key_exists()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHParray_key_exists()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
